meanings.definition: The main process of a neuron that conducts impulses away from the cell body.
meanings.sent1: The neuraxon carries messages from the brain to the rest of the body.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the neuraxon to understand how signals travel in the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The neuraxon decided to take a vacation from transmitting signals, causing a temporary communication breakdown.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a neuraxon, always moving forward and never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The neuraxon resembled a long, winding road, guiding information along its path.

meanings.definition: The long, slender projection of a nerve cell that conducts electrical impulses.
meanings.sent1: A damaged neuraxon can disrupt the flow of electrical signals in the body.
meanings.sent2: The neuraxon extends like a wire, transmitting vital information throughout the body.
meanings.sent3: The neuraxon threw a party for all the nerve cells, celebrating their hard work in transmitting messages.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as straight and focused as a neuraxon carrying impulses.
meanings.sent5: The neuraxon resembled a delicate thread, connecting different parts of the body with its electrical messages.
